doc.after: The Rectification of Names (Chinese: æ­£å; pinyin: ZhÃ¨ngmÃ­ng; WadeâGiles: Cheng-ming) is the Confucian doctrine that to know and use the proper designations of things in the web of relationships that creates meaning, a community, and then behaving accordingly so as to ensure social harmony is The Good (Tian). Since social harmony is of utmost importance, without the proper rectification of names, society would essentially crumble and "undertakings [would] not [be] completed".
